snippet: The sister of Mohamed Bah, who was killed in his apartment building last month, said their mother wanted an ambulance, not the police, to come help him the day he died.
abstract: Some 75 members of the Guinean community in New York rally in front of Police Headquarters to protest the death of Mohamed Bah, who was fatally shot by a police officer responding to a 911 call from family members; demonstrators question whether officers had adhered to department's detailed protocol for dealing with emotionally disturbed people.
lead_paragraph: The sister of Mohamed Bah, who was killed in his apartment building last month, said their mother wanted an ambulance, not the police, to come help him the day he died.

headline.seo: Relatives of Mohamed Bah Rally at Protest of Fatal Police Shooting
headline.main: Relatives Rally at Protest of Fatal Police Shooting
headline.print_headline: Questions About Procedure at Rally for Man Killed by the Police
